Description: Head of terracotta female figure, in Tanagra style. Her hair is arranged in 'melon style'. Himation drawn over head and around neck. Delicate features, rounded dimpled chin. Mould-made and solid. Traces of white coating. Red-brown Nile silt. Broken at neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Late 4th to 3rd century BC parallels from Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, nos. 68, 122, 228-31, 251, see 137). Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.370) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4558 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
